title: Using plus(+) sign with OFN and CSEmailMessage Parameter
author: Jorji Macatangay
content: Would be useful if we have a way to be able to include plus(+) sign in OFN and Email Body (CSEmailMessage) Parameters without it changing into a SPACE.  Using URLENCODE (%2B) but this does not work.

comments.content:
Hello Jorji, thank you for submitting this idea! The handling of special characters in button code is determined by Salesforce. Specifically, in the case of buttons, the plus symbol is used to represent spaces. Even when using the URLENCODE function, Salesforce converts a space into a plus symbol as part of its URL encoding process (source: https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.customize_functions_urlencode.htm&type=5)
Unfortunately, until an alternative method is provided for using plus symbols differently, we won’t be able to consider this change for future implementation.
Thank you for your understanding.

title: Action buttons on the cart gets misplaced after every upgrade.
author: Tirthak Kothari
content:
Hi team,
 
Every time a customer performs an upgrade, their Cart Action buttons get misaligned. Even though the sequence in the backend is correct, the UI doesn't reflect the same data. This is an intermittent issue and happens generally for custom flows in the customer org. Even if run the Custom Settings Maintenance, the issue will be still be observed. As a workaround, to resolve this, the customer needs to run the Custom Settings Maintenance for each flow individually and that too for each "Display Type".
 
The customer has more than 15 flows in their org and it is not feasible to go through this tedious process as it is very time-consuming.
 
Hence, we should handle this within the Product as the buttons on the UI should be aligned with the backend data after the upgrade.
 
Note that, the issue occurs not just for major release upgrades but even a patch upgrade.
 
Thanks!

title: Support for Multiple Template Versions in OneDrive Integration
author: Dan John
content:
I would like to submit a feature request based on a scenario reported by a user involving template generation and file upload processes with Salesforce and OneDrive.
Scenario:
First Run:
The button is executed in Salesforce using a template.No fields in the Salesforce record are updated during this run.The template is generated and saved to OneDrive.
Second Run:
The button is executed again with the same template.During this run, fields in the Salesforce record (Home Phone, Work Phone, and Email) are updated.A new template is generated to reflect these updates.
Problem: The updated template from the second run overwrites the previously saved template in OneDrive from the first run.
 
Use Case: The user would like the ability to upload and preserve both versions of the template (from the first and second runs) in OneDrive. This functionality would enable storing multiple versions of the template, similar to how Salesforce manages multiple records or versions.
 
Request: Implement a feature to allow the preservation of multiple versions of templates in OneDrive, preventing overwrites and enabling version management.

title: Merge a text that contains '&#number' as a literal text instead of an ASCII Character/Symbol
author: Maybeleen Matammu
content:
The Conga Email Template renders a '&#number' character sequence into a symbol. Currently, there's no straightforward solution to merge it as a literal text.
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.mc_es_ascii_characters.htm&type=5
 
Here are workarounds:
1. Use the HTML number that would render the ampersand or the hashtag symbol.
2. Merge the text into a document rather than in a Conga Email Template. This way, the characters will be merged as literal text in the document.
3. Use a Salesforce Email Template instead of a Conga Email Template. This will also merge the characters as a literal text.

title: Field Expression precedence over manual changes
author: Rajesh Mishra
content:
Hi Team,
 
We want to default second attribute i.e. ‘Attribute2’ based on the value in first attribute i.e. ‘Attribute1’. Moreover, if a user changes value in second attribute i.e. ‘Attribute2’ then it should allow the manual change. However, if the value in first attribute i.e. ‘Attribute1’ is changed then the second attribute should be defaulted again based on its value.
 
We are able to achieve the same partially using field expression and keeping its field ‘Ismodified’ to true. But, if we change first attribute again after changing second attribute manually then field expression does not defaults the second attribute.
 
PAR in this case can default the value in second attribute but only once as PAR will not be executed once the attribute changes. Moreover, we can’t have field expression and PAR written on the same attribute parallelly.
 
So Idea is to have Field expression priority precede over manual intervention, moreover allow manual changes too on the target attribute if primary attribute remains the same.

title: Enhance the /approveRequest API call to designate the actual approver
author: Brian Gertsch
content:
The /approveRequest API call does not allow designating who is approving a request. This is needed in instances where we have a delegate approver who is notified about an Approval. For instance, if an approval is originally assigned to User A, but User A has a delegate configured in the system, User B, then the Approvals module will notify both User A and User B. We currently enable the approval through a third-party application which makes the /approveRequest API call. However, there is no way to indicate in the API call whether the approval was completed by the assigned User A or delegate User B. We need to add a parameter for actualApprover to the /approveRequest API call
 
According to the latest documentation for the Approvals API (link: https://documentation.conga.com/approvals/latest/salesforce/approvals-rest-apis-225250750.html) the following call is created to allow recording an approval:
 
Approving Approval Requests
POST /approveRequest
This API is used to approve approval requests. This API accepts the ID of the approval request and comments as input parameters.
 
This documentation gives the following example JSON message body:
{
"requestId": "a1WJ0000003ACuKMAW",
"comments": "test comments"
}
 
We propose adding the following new, optional "actualApprover" parameter:
{
"requestId": "a1WJ0000003ACuKMAW",
"comments": "test comments"
"actualApprover": "0051300000B4uxLAAR"
}
 
 
Please consider supporting this need.

title: Increase decimal value from 15 to 50 for righthand comparators in Conga Approvals with Conga CPQ
author: John Hammons
content:
We have use-cases with custom fields being used with auto-reapproval criteria in Conga Approvals. With these it is currently failing due to comparisons and rounding:
The left hand comparator will be taken as the direct value as it was the existing value.The right hand comparator is re-calculated, and as a result it is rounded to the 15th decimal value.
The actual custom field shows the value as being the same; in Approvals with comparing the custom field in the right hand comparator value the criteria fails as it is rounded to the 15th decimal value. As the custom fields get more complex the number may be more off due to the rounding.
 
With increased decimal support we should not encounter issues as often.

title: XAC 2.0 Mark field date format error on third party documents
author: Snehal Hissal
content:
Background :
Customer is looking for the mark field in third party documents which are getting uploaded to system using import offline functionality. And they are not generated through existing templates in the system.
 
They are trying to use 'mark field' on such documents using XAC 2.0 but it is giving error as 'Please select a content that is compatible with the chosen field. The selected value May 9, 2024 is not compatible with the field data type DATE (MM/DD/YYYY)'
 
In the Documents which the Customer is Importing, if the date values are in "MMMM d, yyyy" format, eg: "March 4, 2024". And when we try to mark this value against any date field(Agreement Start Date or Agreement End Date, etc) we are getting the following error message: Please select a content that is compatible with the chosen field. The selected value March 4, 2024 is not compatible with the field data type DATE (MM/DD/YYYY)
 
--> And if we change the Date value from "March 4, 2024" --> "03/04/2024"(MM/DD/YYYY) then it works
 
Customer's concerns:
if they update the date format to match the supported format i.e. (MM/DD/YYYY) , then when an agreement is viewed globally and date is displayed in agreements as "03/04/2024", it is very confusing. People from US will assume end date is March 4th (mm/dd/yyyy) but people from India will assume it is April 3rd (dd/mm/yyyy). The date format changes globally. That's why we want the format as "March 4, 2024" to avoid confusion
 
--> We can only mark a date value against a date field using XAC2.0 only if the date value which is in (MM/DD/YYYY) format. Any other format apart from this is throws error
 
--> Why this limitation?
 
--> Customer's request: Date can be stored internally in the format "mm/dd/yyyy" but we are requesting for display format as "Month dd, yyyy" when user marks date field as smart field in third party agreement document
 
Referenced JIRA : https://conga.atlassian.net/browse/COREAPPS-11178
TS Case : 00887530 
 
As this is currently product limitation, customers are looking forward to consider this as enhancement.

title: Word quotation error: Error! Unknown op code for conditional.
author: Team CESAR
content:
When using if statements in Word templates, you might want to check whether the value is filled in Salesforce before inserting it.
An if formula in Word might look like this:
IF "{{HTML:INSTRUCTOR_QUALIFICATION }}" = "" "" "{{HTML:INSTRUCTOR_QUALIFICATION }}"
 
If the value of instructor_qualification includes quotation marks (") Word is throwing the following error: Error! Unknown op code for conditional. This is because the quote in the value is closing the if formula. It cannot be an option to change all values and replace double quotation marks with apostrophes.
 
It would be a great enhancement if Conga would find an option to also include values that include quotations in the if formulas of Word templates.

comments.content: Thank you for your idea. I have moved to future consideration

On the Cart, if we have 2 bundles and both of them have the scope and the benefit. If we try applying incentives on both the scopes it applies benefit only once in the first bundle which has the lowest primary line number. The second bundle will never have the benefit applied even though the Promotion Scope & Benefit are present on both bundles.
 
Scenario - 2
On the Cart, if we have 2 bundles and both of them have the scope and the benefit. There is one benefit that is already applied to the first bundle. 
When we apply the promotion on the second bundle, we see that this promotion is not getting applied on the second bundle as there is a benefit that has already been applied on the first bundle
 
GEHC Business Use Case: 
The Customer needs the benefit to be applied on bundle level and not on the cart level.
The priority of assigning benefit products should be given to the bundle level first then to the cart level. But right now it applying on the cart level. 
 
Promotion design gives a 10% discount on upgrading laptop storage to 1 TB
Use case:
Example: - In the cart we have two Laptop configure
 

 
In my case, Just want to apply a Promotional discount to the second bundle/product (Dell XPS 14) -- but based on Scenario - 1 - the benefit is getting applied to the first benefit product that is, and the option/configure line of Bundle-1 (Dell Inspiron 5559). 
 
Please find the attachment under the idea which has sample data use cases.

title: CLM -  Error handling notifications
author: Florence Eden
content:
This Feature Request is submitted on behalf of Allianz Partners.
This may apply to different part of the CLM product suite but is critical for a strong user adoption as it would help educate the users as they use the system.
 
Users would like to get an error handling notification when a process is failing.
Here are a few examples:
When the users start a "send for review process", they do not know that the process fails.
	They do not get notifications such as "wrong file type is being used" or "file size too big" for process to complete.Therefore the user does not know that the process has not been initiated.
Importing a document into CLM
	When a user uploads a third party contract in the system, the document has a .doc extension. Thank you for considering this enhancement.
Florence

title: Product Complexity Score
author: Jai Patel
content:
As part of this requirement, GEHC would like Conga to give a feature/framework which helps define complexity of a bundle w.r.t. its performance so that the product modeling team can identify which bundles need optimization and the sales users can understand that certain bundles will be slower due to their complex nature.
 
As part of the modeling process, GEHC calculates the complexity score of offerings. The intention of this calculation is to help configuration management leaders and administrators understand how complex the offering is and its impact on the configuration experience for the sales representatives. For example, the expectation is that offerings with their complexity score marked “Complex” shall have lower performance (higher load times for the configurator) while those marked “Low” shall have comparatively better performance (lower load times for the configurator).
 
Conga has shared various parameters involved in loading of the bundle on configuration page. However, GEHC has not been able to relate the computed complexity score and the configurator load times/ performance. They have seen offerings with Complexity score “Low” have as much or sometimes even longer load times than offerings that have been marked complex.
 
This makes it difficult to understand how to define the complexity of our offerings and the potential impact to the sales users. This is also preventing us from defining a framework for identifying and measuring offering complexity. This information is critical to determine how the platform can guide our administrators to optimize the offerings.
 
Please refer the attached pdf document on the parameters used and the detailed analysis done by GE so far.

title: Allow Section View, not only clause view, on Record level
author: Anika Pinnell
content:
Current Challenge: When utilizing templates that contain multiple sections and clauses, our current system highlights only the individual modified clauses during the review process. This isolated view does not provide a comprehensive understanding of the changes within the context of the entire section.
 
Proposed Solution: We suggest the implementation of a feature that allows for the highlighting of the entire section in which any clause has been modified. This would enable a holistic overview, preserving the logic and coherence of the entire chapter, rather than limiting the focus to a single sentence or clause.
Benefits:
Enhanced Contextual Understanding: Experts can evaluate the full impact of changes within the context of the entire section, ensuring that the logic and flow of the document remain intact.Improved Review Efficiency: A section overview, adjacent to the clause overview, would streamline the review process, allowing for quicker identification of changes and their implications.Increased Flexibility: Our use case involves plain text fields between marked clauses that are editable by users without highlighting changes. The proposed feature would accommodate this unique requirement, preventing the loss of crucial information during the review.
We have encountered challenges where the lack of section highlighting leads to an incomplete picture for our experts, hindering their ability to assess the full extent of modifications and their ramifications on the chapter as a whole.

title: Process large number of BillingSchedule records asynchronously (in special scenarios)
author: Juraj Moza
content:
Hello
We have non-standard cases where we have 10+ years, monthly Agreements with Bundles with 50+ Options
In such cases we are inserting very big volume of Billing Schedules ~ 7k which results in Heap Size
On top of that we can have case where it can generate more than 10k BSs and if we are processing them as of now Sync - we'll hit a Salesforce DML Limit
What we suggest and we want to have hopefully:
1. One flag/field on the Agreement or we can reuse the "QTC Profile" and add a new picklist value - for example Non Standard
We expect that when this value is set (we can do it on our own, thru our custom logic)
1.1. All processes will act as Enterprise case - ASync Activation of Agreements/Orders/Assets
1.2. We load the BSs in ASync mode - Batch, as we discussed if size 1 is the easiest - it's fine
2. For the same flag/field we hope we can have a one more option on:
Order System Properties => System Properties => Order Item Activate Batch Size
Why we need that
Most of the Agreements (maybe 95%) are with very simple Bundles (few Options) where we can use bigger size for example 10 or 20,
but currently we are forced to use 1 - because of the scenarios as the one described above
As you expect this since one is making activation of the Agreements quite slower than before but we don't have a choice as we can't dynamically change it per Agreement.
This we think is way less complex than the one above as it will just read the setting and apply the Batch Size for the OrderActivateJob
So what we expect is 1 new Option:
Order System Properties => System Properties => Order Item Activate Batch Size (Existing for Enterprise flag) which we can bump to 10
Order System Properties => System Properties => Order Item Activate Batch Size (New one for Non Standard flag) that we will put to 1 as it is now for all our cases

title: Need solution to perform external third party API callout(which updates data in SFDC) when using Out of the box Copy action in Turbo enabled shopping cart.
author: Mohit Patel
content:
Use case : When user does copy operation in the shopping cart, Externally configured (through third party configurators) items needs to be copied into configurator. For that, configurator provided Silent copy API. This API will create copy of the line-item inside the configurator and run validation to update latest configuration and pricing and then saves all the data back to SFDC Line item & related child object using REST API exposed on SFDC side.
 
Current Solution: 
We are using OOB Copy action button inside shopping cart.We are using OOB beforeCopyBundleLineItems method of Action callback class to populate two custom fields (Is copied from & Copy Is In Progress)OOB copy operation will create new line item and will copy all the fields from previous/copied from Line item to new line item.Turbo Pricing will get execute for new line item.In TP callback’s onPriceItemSet method we invoke third party configurator API (silentCopy) to get the item copied into configurator.Configurator will create the item and validate the configuration & pricing  and at last will save back all the data on SFDC via REST API exposed on SFDC.Configurator will send back the response to TP callback silentCopy API call.Pricing will continue and post completion, Line item data saved back to shopping cart as part of OOB Turbo sync.
 
Problems in current architecture :
Configurator updates back the Line-item data on SFDC while price call is in progress on the Turbo side.Now SFDC line-item has updated data(price fields) but turbo still has old line-item data, so we will be ending up with incorrect prices and configuration in the shopping cart. Moreover, Turbo sync will overwrite the Line item data and possibility of loosing data saved back by the configurator.Reason behind using TP callback to invoke silentCopy API was the absence of any pre-price hook or unavailability of afterCopy function on SFDC side. Also, we can’t use Line item trigger since external callout from trigger will not be supported.Sometimes configurators takes more than 30 seconds to respond back since copy/validation is complex operation so we might face Turbo time out issues. Though we can mitigate this issue by increasing Turbo time out value.
 
Current Architecture Diagram

title: Support Importing Bulk Legacy Documents w/Existing Metadata Use Case
author: Chris Shelor
content:
CCI -> CFS Instance
CCI is ostensibly (and is most definitely sold by Sales as) a great tool for moving a legacy contract repository into a better, more modern, reportable repo using CFS + Salesforce. In practice, this use case is barely supported with current product functionality.
Particularly if the legacy contract repo contains metadata associated with the contracts, it is a very difficult, error-prone, time-consuming process to get this done.
Issues and difficulties:
CCI only supports uploading 100 documents at a timeCCI doesn't support uploading a document while also including metadata from a third party source to map to fields on the created Contract Agreement recordBecause of #2, users are required to manually enter an external doc ID during review so that we can find and dataload external metadata once the CCI review process is complete. Does this work? Yes. Is it reliable, scalable, and easy to use for end users? Absolutely notCCI does not allow users other than the one who uploaded it to review a document, making it hard to gang tackle a migration project. Exception: this is possible if the extraction template is configured as Level 2 and additional users are added as approvers. However, users must now both review and then approve the same data. It is redundant, time-consuming, and a frustrating UXAgain because of #2, admins must follow behind the review process by end users and dataload all the created CA records with their external metadata
User Stories
As an admin managing the migration of contracts into CFS + SF using CCI, I need a way for CCI to consume documents using automated extraction while also sending external metadata into mapped fields on the CA recordAs an end user reviewing documents during migration, I need a way to allow a team of reviewers to see the documents I upload without having to both review + approve the same document in a redundant fashion
 
I'm sure there is more we can talk about here but this is all I can think of for now haha. Thanks!

comments.content: Hi,1. CCI on RLC allows upload of up to 1000 documents from a folder.2. need more information on the metadata third-party source being referred to here.3. linked to 2.4. currently CCI allows the Owner of the document can assign the document to another user to complete the review. Select the document by clicking the checkbox on the left, and under bulk action below the search text box, a user icon will appear. click on this icon and selecting the user to assign to, the owner will be able to assign the document for review to another user.

title: Allow Admins/End Users to View the Connected Contract Agreement before Review/Approval is Complete
author: Chris Shelor
content:
CCI -> CFS Instance
When uploading a document into CCI, a Contract Agreement record is created as soon as the processing is complete. i.e. as soon as Status changes to Ready for Review, there is a CA record connected to the CCI record. However, admins and end users have no way of discerning this connection outside of doing a global search on the file name in the SF org.
Why does this matter?
If any part of the review/approval fails, or the CCI record needs to be deleted, or anything happens other than a happy path use case, it is very difficult and time consuming to find the connected CA record and keep that in sync with the CCI record (i.e. mark as junk data, delete, make manual updates, etc). During our testing and attempted UAT with FactSet, this created lots of junk CA records that we couldn't determine if they were junk or not without time consuming, manual text matches on files names.
 
Persona scope:
This is a must-have for admins, a nice to have for end users
 
User story:
As an admin, I need a way to easily find the Contract Agreement record connected to the CCI record as soon as that connection is established so that I can easily manage my Salesforce data should any issues arise during the CCI review processAs an end user, I need a way to easily find the Contract Agreement record connected to the CCI record as soon as that connection is established so that I can easily update my Contract Agreement should I need to bypass the CCI review process for any reason

comments.content: Hi, Currently CCI provides a link to the agreement record after the document Review is complete. We will look into including the agreement record link when the document is in "Ready for Review" status as well.

title: Improve Error Handling for Data Sync with Salesforce
author: Chris Shelor
content:
CCI -> CFS Instance
When completing the review of a document uploaded in CCI, there are no error handling controls in CCI to help users with ensuring that the data to be synced to Salesforce matches the mapped fields' datatypes.
Ex: The CCI Notice Date provision is mapped to a Date type field in SF. Depending on the contract, CCI might pull out something like "90 days before the termination of this contract", which is a text value and not a date value. Currently, unless the user fixes the CCI extraction to be an actual Date, when they complete the review on the document:
the sync will failthe document status will go to "Error - Error in Review"the user will see an unhelpful message about the data type not being valid (Note: it is helpful for admins, but end users will not understand it at all)the document must be re-submitted and the entire review process starts from scrach
This is a very poor UX for end users who know nothing about Salesforce architecture and can't be expected to know and match every data type on their mapped provisions during CCI review. The worst part of it is that there is no way to resolve the errors and the user must start over. This frankly makes the product borderline unusable and must be rectified ASAP. Note that the solution of only mapping CCI provisions to text fields will more or less ensure this issue doesn't happen, but it also ruins reporting capabilities by not using native SF field data types as designed
 
User Story:
As an end user reviewing documents uploaded into CCI, I should not have to know the data types of the fields that my provisions are being mapped into. CCI should provide a way for me to easily rectify the data types that don't match instead of forcing me to start over from scratch with an error message that I don't understand

comments.content: Hi,for every field/clause that is mapped to a provision, user have an option to edit the extracted values to match the underlying salesforce datatype. Since CCI creates an agreement record on salesforce, the values sent back to salesforce must match the datatype it is mapped to, failing which salesforce will throw an error. Thereforce, during document review, datatype check against the value assigned is done to make sure there is no mismatch. Regarding the error message, CCI now displays an error message with following information: field/clause where the data mismatch has occured, the value assigned and the datatype expected.

title: Better Error Message With Text and Rich Text Fields Loading into a Conga Merge
author: Joel Saukas
content:
When using a Word doc composer solution, our users frequently experience an error with the text "The operation was canceled." Once they correct this issue by either removing the double quotes or using the "Remove Formatting" button in the rich text field in Salesforce, the merge runs with no issue.
 
We've provided training and help bubbles for our users in Salesforce, but in the Conga Composer merge screen, they only see an error of "The operation was canceled." This leads to them starting a ticket with our support team stating that they are unable to run their merge successfully. The object record that they are running the merge from has dozens of fields, so they seem to forget the additional training they've had on using rich text fields.
 
If there was some sort of Conga internal work to check for this during the merge, and then display it to the user, that would be extremely helpful. Like "Error encountered with field_name, please correct."

title: Local Currency Conversion
author: Rekha Jangir
content:
Currency Conversion by storing prices in native currencies.
As per the business we have seen within the AMESA team, businesses use local currency to manage the prices and if there is a need to price in different currencies then they use currency exchange rates. Also, these exchange rates keep changing every month. Now conga only supports having prices stored in a single global currency and based on different currencies, conga will handle the conversion. If we go with this supported way then we have to update all the prices every month as after conversion original rate will be affected. So we need to know a way within Conga by which we can our price in the local currencies.
 
Sample Example
 
Product Price (CHF): 1000
CFH to USD Conversion Rate: 0.9
i.e Product Price (USD): 900
Next Month CFH to USD Conversion Rate: 0.91
i.e Product Price (USD): 910
 
Now if we store Product Prices in USD then
Product Price (USD): 900
CFH to USD Conversion Rate: 0.9
Product Price (CHF): 1000
Next Month CFH to USD Conversion Rate: 0.91
Product Price (CHF): 989.01

title: Clause Library functionality limitations – Adding new clauses through “Negotiate”
author: Sridhar Pasumarthy
content:
The user should have the ability to add additional clauses (outside of those configured with the existing templates) using the Clause Library to a generated contract. 
Bala mentioned during the redlining demo that the “Negotiate” function is limited to only replacing the configured template clauses and does not provide the functionality to add clauses from the Clause Library as new sections to the generated contract. If a user needs to add a new section/clause/language to the contract, they cannot use the Clause Library and “Negotiate” function. The user must open the generated contract in Word and manually insert the necessary language. 
However, through this method, CfS (or Conga Composer) cannot recognize the inserted clause/language as a clause already existing in the Clause Library and will not provide the user with alternate clauses. 
 
screenshot attached

title: Shopping cart column visibility through permission sets
author: Saumil Deodhar
content:
Currently, if a system admin needs to show or hide a field on the shopping cart, they need to add the field to the cart flowàdisplay column settings and then set up the configure products button to launch the appropriate flow when the user opens the cart.
 
In case there’s a field that the admin wants to show to a specific set of users (for example, Sales Reps in the US) and hide it from another set of users (for example, Sales reps in Germany) then the admin would need to configure two separate flows and setup them to be used by sales rep of respective countries. The same would need to be done if different users from different countries wish to see different fields on the cart.
 
In cases where a single org is being utilised by multiple countries (in the case of Roche 50+), its not scalable to create and manage more than 50 views to control the visibility of the fields on the shopping cart.
We need a capability to hide/show fields based on permission sets since they are much easier to maintain and set up.

content:
Current:
a) Approval request can be assigned to someone who is not part of the approval list.
b) Once the approval is assigned to the person who is not part of the approver list, they are able to approve it.
The Reassign action allows the Approver to reassign to any other user/queue. When someone is part of Approver queue they can directly take the ownership of that approval request by clicking on ‘Take Ownership’ button.
 
Required:
a) Approval request can't be assigned to someone who is not part of the list.
b) If it is not assigned then this scenario will not occur.

title: User shall be able to view the name of the person to whom the approval is assigned to in the "assigned to" tab
author: Akshay Vaibhav
content:
Current:
After taking ownership of an approval request, the name of the person who took the ownership is not displayed in the Approval flow. Only After approval, the approvers name is displayed.
For any approval request, when the ‘Assigned to’ is a Queue, and a member from the queue takes the ownership of the approval request, they will see the approval history getting updated with relevant comment about the ownership change, also this approval request would be visible in the My Approvals tab. However, here the assigned to will still remain as the queue itself.
 
Required:
User shall be able to view the name of the person to whom the approval is "assigned to" instead of the Queue once the person has taken the ownership of the approval.

title: Create unique identifier for Conga application tasks
author: Bill Lesko
content:
We have a use case from a customer, where they need a method to identify tasks that are created in SFDC from Conga CLM. Specific use case:
 
Summary: We need to know how to easily identify any Conga (docusign, template) Tasks that are created
 
The task records in our org always require a TASK__C value  when a completed task is added. We do this for various business reasons.
We want to be able to simply identify when conga generated tasks are created so that the validation rule can easily bypass the requirement for TASK__C to be valued when loading a Conga task record. We are not in favor of looking at the subject itself because if new task subjects are added by the Conga or DocuSign product at a later time, then the Validation rule will need to be updated – but first we would need to know that new tasks subjects are being used.
 
What we would like to do is find a simple way to identify the Conga created tasks so that the validation rule can elect to not enforce the validation rule for Completed tasks
 
the request is to build into the product some way to identify the Conga created tasks. Possibly a flag or some common verbiage in the subject line, i.e. "APPTS or Conga...."
 
This applies to CLM, Templates, and any other Conga objects that have tasks created from them as part of the CLM (or CPQ) processes.
 
Thanks

Additionally, when applying a discount to the Total Price, the configuration of a custom price point hinders the ability to cascade the discount to individual line items.
 
To be Capability:
Enable users to display the cumulative value of Custom Price Points in the Grand Total when they have set up additional pricing points following the Net Price calculation. This adjustment will address the previously mentioned cascading issue.

comments.content: Unfortunately, we don't have an out-of-the-box feature capability to achieve the same, so will have to wait for the Total level waterfall.

title: Billing Frequency changes without amendment process
author: Sreenivasulu Sake
content:
We have a use case where customer is charged with a Billing Frequency of Monthly for one year duration and after Invoicing for 3 months and customer requested to change the billing frequency to quarterly, to achieve this Conga system expects to go through entire amendment process by changing the billing frequency, in this case system creates negative billing schedules for the invoiced period and new billing schedules with new frequency for the whole period.
 
Expectation: System should not touch the invoiced billing schedules and adjust only the future(pending) billing schedules
 
However this can be achieved by changing the start date through amendment process
 
As the change is expected on the billing frequency and no impact on the pricing, the expectation is to avoid the amendment without changing the start/end date on the lineitem
 
Note: This has been already communicated to the product team and hence creating this idea

title: Display a summary to the user indicating the list of changes to setup in case of favourites/cloned quotes
author: Shahid Ali
content:
There are non-mandatory defaults setup via constraint rules in equipment offerings. These rules are constraint rules with “Auto-Include” action intent and “Warning” as the action disposition. There are specific scenarios when the Conga configurator does not retain the user selections for these rules when using standard configurations, favorites and when cloning custom configurations during the quoting process. The configurator fires these defaults irrespective of the choices made by the user. This behavior is confusing our sales users because options that they are not expecting are getting added to the configuration on the quote. This results in a lot of re-work because they lose time in identifying these options and re-configuring them.
 
 
When non-mandatory default rules don’t exist at the time of bundle configuration and are created later we should ccontinue to fire the non-mandatory default rules (current behaviour) but display a summary to the user indicating the list of changes to setup since the bundle was last configured. This will help the user understand the changes and review the configuration.

content:
Currently the data sync system syncs the dependent objects even when there is no releavant change in the master object to be synced. Since we already have metadata info, Can we make the sync smarter to make sure the dependecy sync is triggered only when we have to update something on child records. title: Need for using PrestoAppId when not doing costing calls (Hitachi Energy)
author: Swapnil Bhandarkar
content:
In a nutshell, the issue is that we are looking send the value of a custom field on the line item to the turbo, but that is currently not happening unless we use the presto app id in the cart url. Can you please help in creating a product jira for the same?
More information below. This is for Hitachi Energy.
 
For the TS ticket (00864899), the issue was that a custom field APTS_ABB_Source_Location__c was not getting passed to turbo when we add a product to the cart.
 
We got the resolution that we should have this parameter i.e. prestoAppId in the cart URL. When we have this parameter i.e. prestoAppId in URL, then the system makes a call for callPrestoForCart action and subsequently the system calls getCartLineItems. In getCartLineItems, we get updated value in APTS_ABB_Source_Location__c, hence that value is getting passed in Web Socket calls successfully.
 
When we do not pass prestoAppId in the cart url, the system doesn't call callPrestoForCart and getCartLineItems explicitly, hence when we land on cart, the system doesn't get an updated value in APTS_ABB_Source_Location__c. This causes the aforementioned issue, as we are currently not passing the prestoAppId in the cart url.
 
From a UAT unblocking perspective this resolution sounds good, but our recommendation is that the above solution is only a temporary workaround. Because the presto app id is supposed to be passed on only for cost related calculations, hence it should not be needed to be passed on the cart when we are not doing any pricing calls.
 
This requires a product fix such that it should be possible to send the value of a custom field on the line item to the turbo without using the presto app id in the cart url. Can you please help in creating a product jira for the same?

title: Product Requirement for Automated Vendor Performance PDF Generation Integration with Conga
author: Emeryll Monique Emelo
content:
Details:
We are looking to enhance our existing vendor performance reporting system within Salesforce by automating the generation and attachment of a monthly PDF report to emails sent to our customers. This PDF report should be auto-generated based on the vendor's performance at the time, and it should include charts, graphs, and other visuals summarizing relevant data points. We are exploring the possibility of using Conga for this purpose due to our existing integration with Salesforce, but we are open to alternative solutions that can seamlessly integrate with our current Salesforce configuration.
 
Problem Statement:
Currently, we send automated vendor performance emails to our customers on a monthly basis via email and Salesforce cases. This same data is also available to customers through our Experience Cloud-based customer portal.

title: CPQ - Expired Price List Items do not show in Catalog

content:
Currently, when a product is designated as an active product but carries an expiration date on the Product Line Item (PLI), there is a request to automatically excluded from the catalog as a selectable product. This adjustment is necessary to prevent user confusion regarding the product's availability on the price list.
 
Presently, the system allows users to add such products into their carts. However, during repricing, the system indicates there are pending changes on the line item, prompting users to click the wrench and configure these changes. Subsequently, users might click on the configuration icon and find no modifications are required. This situation leads to unnecessary confusion and requires additional troubleshooting resources to find why an available catalog product is "not working".
 
To enhance user experience and streamline the process, it is suggested that the system dynamically manages expiration dates for active products. This automation would eliminate the need for users to manually assess product availability and avoid unnecessary confusion caused by pending changes that do not require configuration.

title: Incentive / Promotion - Display the Benefit Quantity as a distinct line item on the shopping cart

content:
Currently, the benefit quantity is included in the Incentive/Promotion section but is concealed within the adjustment line item. It would be beneficial to have the benefit quantity displayed as a separate line on the shopping cart, allowing end users to see it and including it on generated documents.
These types of promotions are particularly applicable to the FMCG and pharmaceutical industries, where promotions often involve receiving an additional product rather than a discounted price. Although such promotions may appear to be limited to B2C scenarios, they are also present in B2B.
As part of this concept, several features could be incorporated, such as:
1) Automatically adding a benefit product to the shopping cart, even if it has not or already been added
2) Removing the benefit quantity line if the item on which the promotion was applied is removed from the shopping cart
3) Making the benefit quantity line read-only (in case added as a sperate line)
4) Clearly marking the product line with a different color or icon to indicate that it has been automatically added as part of the promotion
5) Including the benefit quantity as a free quantity, meaning that there is no pricing impact
Suggestion: It may be more challenging to apply this idea to complex bundle products, so it could be limited to the standalone items.

title: API to return progress result from pricing queueable jobs to display pricing progress.
author: Irfan Khan
content:
Conga has an API which returns the progress result of pricing operation. This API gives the percentage completion details of the batch job that is being run with the async pricing in progress. It has no direct linkage to the number of line items getting priced. The % complete indicates the % of jobs completed, not the % of priced items. This is a very generic job monitoring API that is meant to display a busy indicator rather than an accurate measure of the task.
 
What is expected here is the 'no of jobs completed' and 'Total no of jobs' as a result of this API. As we know that how many items are there and what is the pricing batch size, so we can easily calculate the both results. 
 
Eg. - 100 items are there which are pending, and batch size is 5 then 100/5 = 20 will be the 'Total no of jobs' submitted in back end. When 'Compute total in separate steps' checkbox is checked then we can increase the Total no of jobs with 1. So it will be 21 .
 
It is very general calculation similar to it happens in batch process. Similar thing can be implement in this new API.

title: Control Update button visibility on Collaboration Request based on condition
author: Sandip Kumar
content:
Hello Product Team,
 
Collaboration Request (CR) has one Update button. This button is visible every time even after Completed and Accepted statuses. When this button is clicked, it resets the CR status and other object records statuses and data, which means CR can go for reprocessing. For our customer, if CR is in these two statuses, CR should not go for the reprocessing. Now, if user by mistake clicks Update button, all previous work and approvals goes in toss, and they have to clone the quote and do a fresh start. To avoid this problem, they hid the Update button but now they were not able to change owner because Update button is not available.
 
Update button might be required by other customer all the time. So, I recommend having an option to hide/disable Update button based on condition defined.

comments.content: This is valid feedback. We will consider this on roadmap with UI revamp. Personalized UI where customers can configure various elements of user experience is key part of UI revamp that is being planned for 1h of 2024. Thanks, Amol

They do wish to automate this as much as possible. They do not want to use the out-of-the-box MS Word functionality for Review -> Compare -> Combine as this leaves too many options for their end-users, and document protection has to be removed for that call to work.

title: Auto Approval upon removal of the product
author: Daria Deikova
content:
Removal of the product that is not related to the already added products in the cart and their approval steps should NOT impact those products auto-approval steps.
 
Prerequisite: On the quote there is an approval process with 3 steps:
 
Step 1: triggered when the product name = Ford
Auto approval criteria: Current Delta Price =Prior Delta price for this product
Step 2: triggered when the product name = Nissan
Auto approval criteria: Current Delta Price =Prior Delta price for this product
Step 3: triggered when the product name = Toyota
Auto approval criteria: Current Delta Price =Prior Delta price for this product
 
Quote has 3 cars: Ford,Nissan, Toyota in the cart and they were all approved.
 
We reconfiguring the cart and removing the Toyota, no changes were done to Ford/Nissan lines.
 
Current behaviour: the removal of any product causes all previouly approved steps to be approved again. If now we would submit the quote for approval again the Ford and Nissan department has to review the quote and actually approve, even though thechnically the auto approval condition were met- the delta price didn`t change.
 
Requested behaviour: when the approval step is evaluated per line basis, actually please evaluate it per line and in the current scenario do not ask for the Ford and Nissan to re-appprve, because for them the auto approval should be triggered, since the removed Toyota product has nothing to do with Ford/Nissan.
 
The addition of the new product doesn`t cause the existing steps to be re-approved, if it`s not related to those approval steps :
Addition of the new product that is not related to the already added products in the cart and their approval steps should no impact those products approval steps. (This is the current behaviour of the system - therefore it makes sence for the removal to work the same way)
 
Prerequisite: On the quote there is an approval process with 3 steps:
Step 1: triggered when the product name = Ford
Auto approval criteria: Current Delta Price =Prior Delta price for this product
Step 2: triggered when the product name = Nissan
Auto approval criteria: Current Delta Price =Prior Delta price for this product
Step 3: triggered when the product name = Toyota
Auto approval criteria: Current Delta Price =Prior Delta price for this product
 
Example:
1) We are selling customer 2 cars: Ford and Nissan. Total: there are 2 items in the cart.
2) Each car is approved by different departments: Ford is getting approved by Ford, Nissan by Nissan.
3) Cart was approved, then it was reconfigured and a new car Toyota was added to the cart, no changes were done to Ford/Nissan lines.
 
Current behaviour: the addition of the new product (Toyota) does not impact the previously approved steps, thereofore they will be auto-approved, and the toyota step will be triggered. This behaves as we would expect and we would also expect the opposite scenario to behave the same

title: e-invoicing for French companies
author: Fabien Sparfel
content:
Hi team,
 
A new regulation in France will state that any company should be able to accept and send e-invoicing. Basically, companies would have the choice to use a solution developed by the french government or deploy a "partner e-invoices platform" that would have been stamped by french regulation authority.
 
This measure will be deployed progressively. Enterprise accounts will have to comply with that regulation by July 2024 and small business by 2026.
 
We have here a chance to develop a solution - or enhance our Composer API features - to launch a solution that any business in France will have to evaluate in the next months.
 
Happy to provide more info !
 
Best regards,
 
Fabien

title: Add new report filter called: “Equal to today + (x) days”
author: Kim Teck
content: Account: University of Minnesota PhysiciansContact: Shawn O'NeillEmail: soneill@umn.eduEnhancement RequestI would like to see a new report filter added called: “Equal to today + (x) days”Expanded QuoteI discovered with the help of your support team that the “Greater than Today + (x) days” does not work as advertised in the help documentation. It returns data AFTER the number of days I key in, not WITHIN the number of day I key in. The workaround support told me to use was to use “Less than today + (x) days” AND then key in a date after xx/xx/2023, so previous events will not be included. Having to key in a hard date each time goes against the automated nature of the report we want to build. See case # 00836242Another workaround was to set two filters, a "Greater Than Today + (x) | 0" and a "Less Than Today + (x) | 365" filter so that it would include any records between the start date from the Greater filter and the end date from the Lesser filter. A new filter called "Equal to today + (x) days" would be simpler for users to use in their reports.What problem do you intend to resolve with the requested functionality?  As an admin, I have created a report to track our Event dates and want to return Event dates in my report within x number of days. I want to create an automatic monthly report without keying in an event start date in the filter each time. It seems unreasonable that “Greater than Today + (x) days” doesn’t work as advertised. The work around in case # 00836242 doesn’t work for an automated report.How do you feel the requested functionality will allow you to resolve your issue?As noted above, when I use the “Greater than Today + (x) days”, it should return the results with dates with those (x) number of days. Since it does not work this way, building a new filter titled “Equal to today + (x) days” is a solution that will work as greater than today was intended to work.

title: In Service CPQ, display prices from price matrices on the bundle configuration page for the options
author: Jai Patel
content:
In Service CPQ, the Service Base price is dependent on matrix pricing so almost all the service products will not have a list price but will have a matrix configured on the PLI. We do not display the matrix price on the bundle configuration page. This is causing a lot of confusion and inconvenience in GE Healthcare.
 
When their business users are selling service bundles and they come to bundle configuration page, they see "0" as that is the list price configured on the PLI. This misleads them to believe that the option has a "0" price and can be given for free. However, when to go to the cart, then they are able to view the final price from matrix. To avoid this confusion and to-and-fro between cart and bundle configuration page, they want to see the final matrix price for the option on the bundle configuration page itself.
 
GE would like to have this feature in the June'23 release as it is impacting one of their biggest regions, USCAN. Below are the more details about the impact:
 
Region : USCAN 
Dollar Impact – Overall business more than $ 2 B. 
No. of Users – 300+
Impact- It will greatly impact the APTTUS adoption, since they have Quote Suite (Excel based tool) which is more flexible & faster. 
Severity – High

comments.content: Hello, We understand the use case and it is critical feeback from end users. Unfortunately, we will not be able to support this on Salesfoce as it will result in governance limit issue. We will for sure want to address this on Conga platform. Service CPQ on Conga platform is planned after Asset Based Ordering functionality support. Service will come around 2H of 2024. Workaround of hiding pricing $0 is already provided to GE team Thanks, Amol
GE has requested for this requirement to be made available as early as possible.

title: Constraint Rule - Match in location
author: Rohit Bavaliya
content:
Hello Team,
 
This is customer new use case where customer wanted to apply a discount on the products based on the 'Match in location option'.
 
Use case:
User has two different bundles 'A' and 'B', In these bundles they have added the same option 'D'. User is configuring both bundles with this option. he set constraint rule which checks if both bundles are from the same location or not. If both bundles have the same location then it throws a validation message to override the base price to 0 for the option 'D'. However, both bundles are from different locations but still they can see this validation.
 
Analysis:
We have discussed this use case with our engineering team. We got confirmation that this scenario is not supported, and constraint rules with match-in locations won't be helpful in satisfying this new use case that user is trying to implement it.
 
Also, 'Match in location' is only supported for some of the 'inclusion use' cases. It's not fully supported, for exclusion or validation.
Hence, this current use case will not be fulfilled by CR. However, there is another solution is you can write a validation callback to achieve this scenario.
 
-- User has requested enhancement for this issue. Also, they requested to mention this limitation in the product documentation.

title: Revamp Autonumbering/Formatting with Unordered Lists
author: Matt Penrod
content:
Following is our detailed description to our Conga Partner Manager and the Client. We have been asked to log a ticket with Support/Product Team, as this is a known issue with the Composer product and affects 90% of our builds. We can usually design around it, but it was a blocker with no solution on this particular project. Colton mentioned a possible solution that had recently been developed, but wasn't able to find documentation on it. From what he described, that solution would fix this bug.   "Upon further investigation into the document generation issue with Tevora’s SOWs (Fixed/Hybrid), we’ve discovered that a problem we thought might be a relatively easy fix in the templates themselves is actually due to an inherent flaw in the Conga Composer product. We encounter this flaw fairly often while building and are sometimes able to design around it. However, in a project like this one where templates and clauses are so heavily dependent on unordered (bullet-pointed) lists, it is nearly impossible to circumvent.   The issue lies with the addition of extra paragraph

tags following unordered lists. This causes each new paragraph in a given clause following an unordered list to generate as a new, separate clause. This causes Word’s auto-numbering to recognize each paragraph following a tag in a clause as a new number, throwing off the auto-numbering and formatting in the document.   Usually, this is a problem we can solve by going into Custom Settings and enabling “clean p tags” and “clean ul tags.” However, in this project, “clean p tags” does not resolve the issue. “Clean ul tags” cannot be utilized due to the reliance on bulleted lists in the templates. We believe it’s possible that restructuring the clause configuration in the library to include any extra paragraph after a

    in a clause as a subclause and adding a subclause merge tag in the template may circumvent the product flaw in Composer. However, there are a few major pain points with this solution:   There are over 90 separate clauses of this clause type currently in the clause library- one for each product available to SOWs. Some of these clauses contain only one paragraph following the unordered list, but many of them contain two paragraphs. Each of these paragraphs would have to be re-added into the library as new clauses and associated to the originals as subclauses for this to operate correctly.   The manner in which the implementation was originally designed would operate correctly for any type of clause except those containing unordered lists. It is only the presence of unordered lists in each clause that causes the document to generate incorrectly. With adoption and ease of use in mind, creating an overly-complicated design to circumvent a known flaw in the product may hamper the ability of future Tevora admins to add new products/clauses to their system. This could lead to a decrease in use and adoption, and an eventual deprecation of product use altogether.   The only other solution to this issue would be to ask the client to fundamentally change the look/feel of their templates to remove bullet-pointed lists altogether. Tevora is understandably unwilling to do this, and we feel they shouldn’t have to. If they chose this option in the end nonetheless, this would also necessitate a retooling of the clause library and clause library for over 90 clauses."

title: Submit for Async Approvals with the flexibility to decide sync/async submission at transaction level
author: Vaibhav Kothari
content:
Salesforce has hit governor limits for certain use cases while submitting for approvals using our synchronous approvals. Apex CPU timeout error is received for quotes with just 100 approval requests. They have Approval Process configured on "Product Configuration" object with child processes at "Line Item" level.

We have tested with May'22 approvals package and the limits are slightly better (close to 130+ approval requests generated). However, Salesforce would like to scale further and evaluated Conga Async Approvals.


As-Is: Conga provides async approvals via below two approaches:

1. Custom Setting: Process Preview/Submit Asynchronously

Pros:

- Customers can retain the existing OOB UI for preview and Submit with comments

- No need to write any custom code to use async approvals


Cons:

- Every approval in the org will go for async processing. This will increase the overall number of jobs in the queue. And for smaller quotes, async processing may also take more time than sync processing.


2. Async API: Apttus_Approval.ApprovalsWebService.SubmitForApprovalsAsync(sObjectType, sObjectId)

Pros:

- Customers will have flexibility to decide at run time (based on defined threshold) whether the approvals need to go to async process or not. This will involve custom code

Cons:

- No Preview and Submit with Comments available

- Custom code is required to consume the API


Ask:

If we instead place the CC recipients before the Signer in the order the CC recipients will receive a notification that the transaction is taking place.

"Query Binary Branch - used to create alternative pathways for a step, depending on whether the action defined in the step proves to be true or false. For example, if you send a contract for eSignature and the contract is not signed within a specified time frame, you can link the False option to a Generic step that requires a user to contact the counter-party via telephone. title: Tracking and Managing Contractual Obligations
author: Vikram Chakrabarty
content: Obligations emerge out of a contract as part of the negotiation process. When two (or more parties) negotiate the various terms and clauses in a contract, what they are really doing is determining the obligations of both parties involved in the contract. Here's a simple but effective and fairly validated idea for an effective obligation management solution, where you start with the usual contract negotiation, arrive at the final set of negotiated clauses at signatures, tag those negotiated clauses as which ones need to be tracked as obligations, categorize the obligations, assign an accountable and responsible owner to the obligations, determine how the obligation should be assessed for compliance (in most cases it would be an assessment survey questionnaire) and lastly determine the number of times in a year you would want to assess the obligatino for compliance. Now the system automatically creates TASKS that send an email notification to the responsible (and accountable) persons as the tasks fall due. The email contains a link to an assessment survey (leveraging Salesforce communities here) which can be filled out by the responsible person and submitted. This submission is captured on the obligation and based on the submitted responses, the accountable person can determine whether the obligation is in compliance, at risk of non compliance or is already in jeopardy.

title: Duration reports should automatically be reported in Conga as a numeric value
author: Kim Teck
content:
EXPANDED QUOTE

My concerns are: (1) the format of the duration reports, are being reported only as mixed text (e.g., 6 days, 23 hours, 45 minutes, 13 seconds) rather than numbers only (e.g., 06:23:45:13 [Days:Hours:Minutes:Seconds]), which is preventing me from building any meaningful reports in Excel based on time because Excel cannot filter time based on the mixed text format that re being produced from Conga; and (2) the duration report being produced is based on "Business Day" as opposed to 24 hour period, which seems odd (what is a "Business Day" (e.g. US Federal Holidays excluded, State holidays excluded (which State), weekends excluded)


WHAT PROBLEM DO YOU INTEND TO RESOLVE WITH THE REQUESTED FUNCTIONALITY?

(1) Duration reports simply do NOT work in Conga because of the mixed text (e.g., 6 days, 23 hours, 45 minutes, 13 seconds). "Yes" mixed text is fine if you are only looking at a handful of agreements but if one is trying to run any type of metric reports and filter that data in Excel then the mixed text is useless. (2) Also, the use of "Business Days" is problematic for the following reasons: what exactly is a Business Day — US Federal Holidays excluded (why US and not Canada, Mexico, or some other country), State holidays excluded (which State), weekends excluded, does a business day start at 9am and en at 5pm and what time zone, what happens when a contract is submitted in Conga at 5:01pm on Friday and all work flow steps are completed and agreement executed at 5:03pm on Friday - if we are going by Business Day then how is that reported in the duration report?


HOW DO YOU FEEL THE REQUESTED FUNCTIONALITY WILL ALLOW YOU TO RESOLVE YOUR ISSUE?

Duration reports should automatically be reported in Conga as a numeric value only that can be filtered by Excel so that true metric reports on how long a particular "Flow Step" took can be reported. Also, there are way too many variables with "Business Days" as a time period - get rid of business days and just use a 24 hour period.


Call me to discuss if I was unclear or if further information is needed. From my position, this is not really an "enhancement" but correcting an error in that is preventing true and useful metric duration reports from being created.


Revance Therapeutics, Inc

Paco Armijo

parmijo@revance.com

510-588-7062

title: Add Previous Amendments of an Agreement
author: Mufaddal Laxmidhar
content:
Let's say there is a long running contract with a loyal customer.

This contract is handled in system in following way -

Agreement A is an original agreement. User amends it and creates B for some use case and makes it in effect. User amends it again after some time and create C and make C in effect.

Now if Customer wants to populate the details of Agreement A and B while generating the document for Agreement C, there is no way to do so.

We do not allow to add merge field of Related Agreements in X-author. that is where the relationship of amendment agreement is kept. Hence, there is no OOB way to serve the use-case atm.

We can allow enable merge fields from Related Agreement up to a certain level so that such use case can also be served.

Note that : We need to allow to select related agreements of the related agreements so that, B's details can be fetched from C and A's details can be fetched from B.

title: Ability to fetch Parent's Child
author: Mufaddal Laxmidhar
content:

1. The selection of child agreement is not obvious at all, we can rename this as child agreements so that User is aware that this is possible. Refer Attachment. (The highlighted section actually pulls in values from child agreement)
2. We do not have the ability to select child agreements of Parent. user may want to populate data for sibling to which he has does not have a direct relation but through the parent, he should be able to do this.
3. We do not have an option to select Parent of a Parent. This could be especially helpful if a user is having loyal customer from like 4-5 years and wants to add the details of older agreements which he has setup as parents. We can ofc limit this to certain level.

title: Contracts Marketplace
author: Mahesh Krishnan
content:
Ideas for alternate revenue streams.

Create an open market place portal for creating/selling templates.

Any contract creator can create templates/clauses libraries legal or any other type and publish them, with a set of online tools provided by us.

Since we at Conga already have a technical know-how, we need to utilize our capabilities extend our functionalities for single-users/lawyers , small scale enterprises.

This portal should be purely self-service.

End users can search for templates (search by ratings/popularity).

Probably provide auto-recommendations for similar templates.

They can be given a form to fill out all the place holders within the templates (names,addresses,dates and other field values).


When a document is generated by a user the original author of the template earns one time fee/or it can be recurring.

Conga earns a part of the fee. Probably earn revenues through contextual Ads/promotions.

This can also extended by integrating Conga sign.

Additionally features for document conversions/Intelligent OCR etc can also be provided on pay per use basis.

Licensing/Pricing - Some features can by made available for free for certain number of uses. For advanced features suitably charge, price it.


Note - This is applicable to any document template not just legal. It can be extended to policy document etc.


Advantages-

Biggest advantage : We have a lot more user data and contracts data, which can be used for internal AI/ML, business intelligence purposes.

We create a large repository of clauses/templates which can be bundled and packaged as a value added services to other customers.

Alternative revenue stream.

Good marketing tool, prospective users can work with larger organizations and prefer to use Conga.

title: Tag unanswered selections in CPQ
author: Matthew vanderHeijden
content:

It would be good to tag those selections that need to be revisited on a later time.

A good analogy would be when you take a test and you don't know the answer. You typically can tag it, move on to the next question and revisit the tagged question later.

This functionality will add value to the user. CPQ will be easier to use and it will prevent incomplete configurations. It will also be a differentiator with our competitors. I don't think anybody has this functionality.

I heard about this functionality in a discussion on a CPQ Opportunity with Shyft.

title: Allow/display discounts on negative prices
author: Maurice Hout
content:
Use Case:
For SimCorp, discounts are applied at quote summary level. This is used in combination with an approval workflow on both discount approvals and deal size approvals. Simcorp has some use cases, where named users are allowed to enter a pre-approved adjustment (controlled through collaboration.) The most important one is when converting existing clients from a perpetual contract to a subscription contract, so it is not an inferior case. It is part of contract transformations. The sales rep may want to apply an additional discount on the quote as is – or maybe there is upselling and discount as part of the conversion. The only way the sales rep can do the discounting is through the quote summary and it is paramount, that the discounting happens consistently across the quote. As negative prices are allowed and as discounts through the quote summary are supported, we expected the value to populate the "Net Adjustment Percent" field when -ve is applied. With -ve the field value is Null.
See attached screenshot where 20% discount was already applied. It doesn't show (right lower corner value .0,00% even when 20% was applied) This is confusing for the End Uses.

Upsell is showing better products of a higher value to the customer. Example: Customer selects a "MacBook Pro 16" Laptop with M1 Pro chip - 16GB Memory - 512GB SSD ($2,499)" The Upsell product would be: "MacBook Pro 16.2" Laptop with M1 Max Chip - 64GB Memory - 2TB SSD ($4,229). In the end the customer select one or the other.

Cross sell is when you are trying to selling for example an accessory of a product the customer has already in the cart (or maybe as an asset)

We need to make a distinction between them with a different rule and a different place to show them.

All our customers are interested in Upsell and Cross sell functionality. It is a MUST HAVE. We need to improve our "recommendation" functionality and make it on par to the industry standard.

author: Jay Patel
content: The customer user case is as given below: 1. They are NOT using our Service CPQ module. 2. The Price List Item of the products which are configured on the Cart are NOT having Related Pricing. 3. They have their own custom flow or use case. For that, they are using our RelatedLineItem Object. 4. The user is configuring one of the Product which they are saying as Hardware or Software Product. 5. Along with the Hardware/Software Product, they are adding Coverage Product on the same Cart. 6. The Hardware, Software & Coverage are the custom types of the Product. 7. So here, the customer wants to create a Relationship between Hardware/Software Products and Coverage Products. 8. To achieve that, they are using our OOTB RelatedLineItem object. The user is creating Hardware/Software LineItem along with Coverage LineItem. RelatedLineItem object is working as a junction object between these 2 LineItems. So, they are putting LineItem as Hardware/Software LineItem Id and RelatedLineItem as Coverage LineItem Id. Along with that, they are putting a Dummy Asset on the RelatedAssetLineItem Id. Because without RelatedAssetLineItem Id, the system will throw NullPointerException. 9. The RelatedAssetLineItem field will have the actual AssetLineItem Id only when they are doing renewals. We explained that the OOTB system will never populate the RelatedLineItem lookup field with another LineItem in case of Service CPQ. But the customer is using this customization since more than a year and they don't want to change anything. The implementation was done by the Partner. As per him, the system can copy everything correctly from RelatedLineItem to ProposalRelatedLineItem to OrderRelatedLineItem or RelatedAssetLineItem. The system is also able to clone the correct data (on new configuration) if we configure the already Finalized Quote. Hence, the issue is only on the Deep Cloning of the Quote using Apttus_QPConfig__ProposalClone VF page. So as per the customer's request, we wanted to know whether this can be fixed from our end or not? They are also OK if we can provide this as an Enhancement or Story. FYI: JIRA: CPQ-50745

title: Data Driven Modeling aka Catalog Driven Modeling
author: Matthew vanderHeijden
content:
When a company wants to add a (new) product / option to an Option Group (which is used in a bundle), the CPQ admin needs to create the new option and needs to add it to the option group(s).

In most situations the Product is added by a Product Manager in a different system and Conga will pick up this product through some kind of integration and the CPQ admin adds the product to the applicable Option Group(s)

It would be a huge improvement if the Product Manager only has to add the Product / Option and that the bundle automatically will "pick-up" the Product / Option at run time based on a query on the Option Group level. The image below shows how this could look like. The query will filter on the product database based on attributes associated with the products.

Results of DDM

* No Model changes if part number is changed or if new items get added
* Smaller Size of model – Only those Option Items that are needed based on selections

Business Benefits:

* Less Model maintenance
* Lower Total Cost of Ownership (TCO)
* Faster time to Market

Rules need to be generic:

* You don't know which products will end up in the bundle

Data driven modeling / Catalog driven modeling is applicable in most situations, but especially for customers that frequently add new products and options.


Attached is a document that includes a image that depicts Catalog Driven modeling

title: Rule Tracer and Debugger in CPQ

content:

It would be helpful for any CPQ administrator to have an easy-to-read tool that traces all the rules that were touched in for a specific configuration.

In this example you can see the duration of each rule execution and you can see the sequence in which the rules are executed and of course the result of the rule.

This request is applicable for every CPQ account

Attached is a screenshot of how debugger could look like

title: Combining Selection and Quanty in one rule
author: Matthew vanderHeijden
content:
Today if you need to create a rule to select a certain option in a configuration model and if the quantity is greater than one, it requires two rules.

First you need to create an inclusion constraint rule to get the Option selected

Second you need to go to the structure of the bundle and go to the correct Option is the Option Group

Then you need to create the expression to calculate the correct quantity for selected Option.

These two rules should be combined in one rule, and it should be easier to do the quantity calculation. The quantity calculation should be similar as our price matrices. With a matrix you probably can handle 90% of all quantity calculations. For the other 10% (very complex quantity calculations) we still need the expression builder, but than in the constraint rule.

Please see the attached file, which includes some screenshots

title: Enabling Composer to Pull Many Children Records from Many Parents Records
author: Nancy Vicari
content:
Allow Qvar to store multiple unique identifiers to be ingested by another query, thus enabling Composer to pull many child records from many parent records.

Use Case 1: Customer makes multiple purchase in a day resulting in many orders that are 'related'. Operations would like shipments to be as cost effective as possible, this means warehouse staff needs to pick and ship inventory in the least amount of boxes as possible based on weight, dimensions and quantities sold on order lines. In order to do so, they will need a pick list printed for picking as well as a pack slip in the boxes before shipment is out the door.

Use Case 2: Consolidated invoicing, similar to above, difference is a finance user is able to print out many invoice lines that are from multiple invoices belonging to the same customer or purchase order number.

Solution: Allowing Composer to query child records based on the following logic (not a SOQL query)

SELECT ProductName, Quantity, Weight, Dimension, Price

FROM OrderLines

WHERE ParentOrderIdentifier IN (QVar Result Set)

Idea: Allow Qvar to store multiple identifiers to be used in another query's WHERE clause with IN. Based on numerous past test, current product capability does not allow that to happen, it gets very close though, the delimitator usually comes out wrong.

Ideally, the feature can output errors when the query exceeds SFDC governance\syntax limit similar to the errors we display for queries that went rough in the datafile today. These type of query can get out of hand fast if someone does not know what they are doing,

title: Single report for records and subset of.
author: Penny Long
content:
Simple Description:

In Lightning interface, End User creates a filtered List View in a custom object to return a list of results. Then while viewing the list of results records, End User *randomly* selects a subset of records from the full list by clicking on checkboxes of records. Then when End User has selected the random records desired from the list, they click a report generation button on the list view/object to output the record dataset to a *single* combined report.
