title: Cart Support for Salesforce Console Apps
author: Ahmad Khalifa
content:
CPQ apps are mostly Standard Lightning apps and we don't currently support Console Lightning apps.

* This is a challenge for customers who already use a Sales Console app or who want to switch to a Console app.
* CPQ screens will work with Console apps but they will result in several confusing tabs that easily lead to confusing situations where users can easily make data errors.

It would be great to extend our UI support to Console Apps.


Some examples of the areas that we don't support that could case issues:

(tabs here refers to Lightning tabs, not browser tabs)

* Finalize Cart - will open a new tab with the Finalize page, then closes it and goes back to the Quote tab. This leaves the Cart tab open still and users could mistakenly go and edit that Cart (which is in status Finalized now). Even worse is when they click on Configure again, this starts another Cart tab - so now you have two Cart tabs and it's easy to remember which is the active one.
* Submit for Approval - when submitting for approval, similar to finalize, several tabs open up. But the confusing part is that retriggering approvals will open the old approval tab that wasn't closed, then the UI does nothing. This is frustrating for users who don't remember to close the tab
* Any Custom VF page opened through a Cart Action, when it redirects back to the Cart, this will result in a separate tab being opened for the Cart. So you end up with two tabs or more for the same cart and they don't show the same values
* Other UI parts like Incentives Manager are also affected

* Consolidate Notifications

title: Prevent creation of multiple DocuSign envelopes at the same time
author: Joseph Franklin
content:
After user selects the file and clicks send for signatures and then immediately clicks back, because of lightning latency issue, agreement page does not immediately refresh, and still shows status as pending/ready for signatures with send for signatures button still showing up. Now the user can send for signatures again, select file and go through the process all over resulting in 2 envelopes getting created (I have noticed if the back button is clicked too soon, status of the first envelope remains blank). However, Docusign console shows 2 envelopes with the status 'Waiting for others'. In this scenario, the recipient would receive two emails with separate envelopes and is able to open and sign both. After signatures are completed, batch jobs that run at every 15 min interval in the background look for any signed envelopes and insert the signed document under files, then update the agreement status to fully signed and update the envelope status to Completed. If the recipient had signed both envelopes in this case, we see both signed docs under Files section, but the Agreement/Envelope Status update fails.


I think we can put in some logic to prevent creation of multiple envelopes at the same time or almost immediately after first envelope is created.

This has been a consistent and major issue for Fannie Mae (Case#'s 00105836 & 00115083) even after several user trainings and needs some control to built in to the product.

title: Allow searching for multiple assets using logical operators and comma separated values on Installed Products page
author: Jai Patel
content:
On The installed products page, we have 2 filter tabs, "Basic Search" and "Advanced Search".


On the "Basic Search" tab, if 'Asset Name" is configured as a filter then at a time, user can search only for one asset. It only accepts one asset name value at a time. GEHC has quotes with large number of assets. This approach of searching assets one at a time is highly time consuming and cumbersome. For all the text fields (especially Asset name), GEHC would like the system to support comma separated values where user can add multiple comma separated asset names and system should be able to search for all the mentioned assets.


On the "Advanced Search" tab,

1. User should be able to apply filter with "AND" and "OR" logic. Currently, only "AND" logic is supported. The "OR" logic is required for to search multiple assets names simultaneously and also to enhance the scope of search criteria.
2. User should be able to search large number of assets by providing multiple comma separated asset names.

This is a critical use case for LATAM, EU & JAPAN as they quote with 200+ assets in one configuration.

title: Conga Sign should send most recent version for Saleforce File Versions (ContentVersions) Created on Same Day
author: Casey Shockley
content:
I would file this more as a 'bug' than an 'idea' or 'enhancement', but nonetheless.


Conga Sign currently does not distinguish correctly between Salesforce file versions when those versions were created on the same day. This can result in the incorrect version of the file being sent for signature when there is more than one version created on the same day that the most recent version was created.

The workaround is to either delete older file versions (unacceptable for our use case because we need to have history available), or to download the most recent file version and upload it back in as an entirely separate contentdocument and set that as primary (cumbersome workaround). We also can potentially catch this issue by previewing our file on the Conga Sign screen before sending, although users don't always do this or may not always see the version differences easily to catch the issue.

We are unfortunately going to have to create automation specifically to address this bug because it is not being fixed by Conga (or not in a timely fashion). The fact that Conga Sign will send out a version other than the most recent file version really reduces our faith in Conga Sign as a platform because certain version changes can be critical and these are documents going to our client or potential clients, therefore reducing our clients' faith in us if we accidentally send an older version of the file.

It should be relatively straightforward to order by ContentModifiedDate with the level of specificity necessary or IsLatest flag or utilize VersionNumber comparisons to identify the most recent version of a document.

title: Visual Summary of CLM/CPQ lifecycle on a timeline.
author: SF Integration Service Account
content:
I would start this idea with a quote from Mark Twain "There is no such thing as a new idea. It is impossible. We simply take a lot of old ideas and put them into a sort of mental kaleidoscope. We give them a turn and they make new and curious combinations. We keep on turning and making new combinations indefinitely; but they are the same old pieces of colored glass that have been in use through all the ages."


This idea is inspired from this "Time Warp" app on appexchange - https://appexchange.salesforce.com/appxListingDetail?listingId=a0N3u00000ONnm7EAD


It gives you an interactive timeline with an ability to slide over the timeline and check the records created. The UI is not too intuitive and I am sure our UX/design experts can improvise this and do better.


For any of our CLM or CPQ implementation, we have full visibility into how much time is spent at each step i.e. to create a agreement/quote, time spent on cart in configuration of products, document generation, approvals, esign, order placement etc.


Using these data points we should be able to generate a visual summary of end to end process along with link to artifacts.


Value add: Deal Desk / Legal team can compare two timelines and evaluate where the most time is being spent/delayed.

title: Asset Line Items should be Versioned
author: Sachin Behl
content:
Asset Line Items should be Versioned


Whenever Asset Line Items are modified as part of ABO operation then new version of the Asset Line Item should be created.

Installed Products should pick the latest version for any new ABO operations.

This will give complete history of the incremental changes that have happed over the period like dates, amounts, configuraiton changes etc.

title: SCPQ - Add an "Is Optional" flag on the Related Line Item object
author: Swapnil Bhandarkar
content:
Scenario :

1. A service model S1 is configured in the cart by associating it to an equipment asset.
2. The service bundle S1 is marked as 'optional' in the cart (so the service options also marked as 'optional').
3. Another service model S2 is configured in the cart by associating it to the same equipment asset as in step 1. This service model S2 is not marked as optional.
4. If we open the Related Line Item records for both the services, then there is no way to know whether the RLI record is associated to an 'Optional' service model or not.
5. For Philips, we are using a new customized RLI screen, and would like to see that the RLI record get an 'Is Optional' flag built-in, that gets set to TRUE or FALSE automatically based on the 'is optional' flag for the service model on the cart itself.
6. This will make it easy for users to identify the 'optional' RLI records instead of checking on the corresponding service model if it is optional or not.

title: Error mechanism to notify on bad configuration data
author: Mihir Shah
content:
Problem statement: Unexpected application behaviour and Erroring in case of bad configuration setup data. Currently there is no robust mechanism to either notify the administrator on CPQ Maintenance console OR Rich Error reporting at transaction time.


Source of the issue: Bad configuration data mainly happens in data migration OR someone delete the fields which are referred in the Rules.

Below table provides the list of objects and fields where bad data can exist. These fields can have blank value OR incorrect field reference where application is expecting a valid field reference.


Troubleshoot challenges:

Due to lack of comprehensive error reporting, the option mostly remain is trial and error, which is always time consuming and painful. Also the customers and partners are then dependent on TS to get the subscriber logs, but that too does not provide such detail Errors.


Error reporting Required:

1) Enhance the maintenance console to report on such bad configuration data (if required field is blank or referring to non-existed field. So the admin can look for such data at one place and handle clean-up proactively

2) Enhance the Error reporting on transaction time by providing the rule reference which is causing the issue so that diagnosis and fix can happen fast.

title: Ability to sell service  on assets belonging to accounts not linked through account hierarchy
author: Jai Patel
content: Business Case: 2 hospitals take help from an organization (can be another hospital as well with its own assets or it can be a non-hospital entity like a Trust or Financer) to negotiate their service contract with GE. The organization will then negotiate with GE for the assets belonging to the 2 hospitals. All the 3 entities (2 hospitals + organization) are "Accounts" in GE's salesforce org. The organization and 2 hospitals are independent accounts and are not tied together by any hierarchy. In order to meet such a request, the salesperson needs to create a quote on organization account and fetch the assets of the 2 hospital accounts on the quote. As per current design, this is not possible. Currently, on the installed products page, we can fetch the assets of the account on which the quote is created or any account which is part of the quote account's account hierarchy. As part of this new feature, we should be able to fetch any asset for the accounts belonging to the same country and sell service on these assets. So, the assets on the installed product page should not be limited to the quote account hierarchy. Example: Salesperson from France should be able to quote service on assets belonging to any French account.
